byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Maher Samaan from Paris; Hwaida Saad from Beirut; a New York Times correspondent from Aleppo, Syria; Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

abstract: Syrian government airstrike destroys Aleppo hospital, killing 27 people and marking return to full hostilities after months of tenuous cease-fire; attacks interrupt deliveries of humanitarian aid to besieged areas and imperil latest efforts at peace talks.

headline.print_headline: Divided Syrian City Plunges Back Into War as Hospital Is Destroyed
headline.main: Divided Aleppo Plunges Back Into War as Syrian Hospital Is Hit

snippet: A hospital assisted by Doctors Without Borders was struck in a government airstrike, killing dozens, and rebels retaliated with deadly mortar strikes.
lead_paragraph: A hospital assisted by Doctors Without Borders was struck in a government airstrike, killing dozens, and rebels retaliated with deadly mortar strikes.
